alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 16 at 3:30PM EST until February 17 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 4 PM EST THURSDAY... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...South winds 10 to 15 mph with gusts of 35 to 45 mph will continue into early evening before diminishing. On Thursday, south winds will increase to 10 to 20 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph expected from mid-morning into the afternoon. Even stronger southwest winds of 15 to 25 mph with gusts of 45 to 60 mph are possible from late Thursday afternoon into Thursday night. * WHERE...Whitley, Knox and Clay Counties. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the second Wind Advisory, from 9 AM to 4 PM EST Thursday. For the High Wind Watch, from late Thursday afternoon through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines late Thursday afternoon into Thursday night. Scattered to widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
